data.sampled: The foreign exchange rates used by ATMs can vary depending on the location, the type of machine being used, and other factors. This difference in exchange rates is known as an "atm fee." The exact amount of the atm fee charged may depend on your bank or credit union, the location of the machine, and other factors. Additionally, some machines may charge fees for non-standard transactions such as currency conversions or large withdrawals. It's important to note that while using an international ATM might save you money over using a domestic one, there may still be other costs associated with the withdrawal, such as conversion fees or exchange rate differences.

data.sampled:
If you suspect that there has been an unusual withdrawal from your bank account, here's what you should do:

1. Check your statements regularly: Make sure you check your bank statements frequently so you can identify any suspicious transactions right away. Look for large withdrawals or transfers made without your consent, or checks written out to someone other than yourself.
2. Contact your bank immediately: If you find something suspicious on your statement, don't hesitate to call your bank as soon as possible. They may need to investigate the situation and take appropriate action.
3. Keep detailed records: Keep copies of all your financial documents, including your statements, receipts, and any other evidence related to the suspected unauthorized withdrawals. This will help you keep track of any potential problems and make it easier to prove your case if necessary.
4. Consider taking legal action: In some cases, you may want to consider taking legal action against the person who withdrew money from your account. Depending on the circumstances, this could range from filing a police report to seeking restitution through civil court. It's always important to seek professional legal advice before pursuing any action.

It's worth noting that many banks offer fraud protection services which can detect and prevent identity theft, but these services cannot replace prompt reporting of suspected criminal activity. By taking steps to protect your personal information and monitor your accounts, you can greatly reduce the risk of becoming a victim of fraudulent activity.

data.sampled:
This depends on your bank and whether or not they offer over-the-counter assistance for this type of situation. If your bank does not provide OTC support, there may be limited options available to you such as waiting until tomorrow when the machine opens again, or trying another branch location. It's also possible that some banks might provide 24/7 assistance for stranded cards, but check with your bank before leaving the scene to see what their policy is. 

In general though, it's always better to call your bank immediately instead of attempting to withdraw money without knowing exactly how long the problem will last. Your bank can usually provide instructions on how to proceed while keeping you updated on any changes to their policies or hours of operation.

data.sampled: In case you forgot your phone or there is no signal, you can still make transactions by using the app's secure offline mode. This feature allows you to perform transactions without having to connect to the internet. To access this mode, go to the App Store on your iOS device and look for "Venmo." Once you find the app, tap on the "Offline" button in the bottom-right corner of the screen. From here, you can perform transactions as usual.
